meanings.sent1: The plant's leaves began to necrose after being exposed to too much sunlight.
meanings.sent2: If you don't water the flowers, they will necrose and wither away.
meanings.sent3: The neglected fruit started to necrose, turning into a mushy mess.
meanings.sent4: The abandoned building seemed to necrose, decaying rapidly over time.
meanings.sent5: The infection caused the tissue to necrose, creating a foul smell.

meanings.sent1: The toxic chemicals can necrose the skin upon contact.
meanings.sent2: The disease can necrose the cells, leading to severe damage.
meanings.sent3: The careless gardener accidentally necrosed the plant by over-fertilizing.
meanings.sent4: The harsh winter frost seemed to necrose the delicate flowers overnight.
meanings.sent5: The venom of the snake can necrose the flesh, causing serious harm.
